body:

There is no downside to this fed bull market. All bad news shrugged off. Stonks only go up.. It's okay to be stupid if it makes me money in this market. $aapl to hit $180 tomorrow.

$AAPL if you want to know what a textbook American power hour looks like…well, there you have it.
$AAPL how many times this yr have we heard tech selloff. Only to rebound. After this new ATH. Let them drop tech for a few days to a week. But the ducking dip! It always rebounds
$AAPL 180 tomorrow gay bois

$SPY $aapl $qqq 🥷🏿

message.body:
$SPY $aapl $qqq Never bet on bears in bull market. Puts won't print, bears are weak. 

Be the bull, buy calls. MMs will work for you to print the calls.

body:
$SPY I don't like this fed pumped bull market. But I know that the market will shrug off anything and will run higher closing the year with new ATHs. Just go along with what market does. 

Bulls are stupid, can't rationalize with them. They are gonna pump all valuations to unsafe territories. Bears are needed in this market. It's unfortunate that bears are weak. 

$aapl $msft
$AAPL $aapl $spy $qqq

message.body:
$AAPL To everyone who is wondering what will happen tomorrow -

Market will run up high. $aapl will lead the way and may hit $180 to print $180 calls. Grab your calls when you can tomorrow.

Market is insanely bullish right now. There is no reason for this market to be even a bit fearful. It has shrugged off every other reason. 

Sell your puts and move to calls asap if you want to be in the winning side. I'm saying what I'm seeing. No bias. 

$spy $qqq

@Uncle_Covid @Jamz83 @AllJackedUp @ShantP21 @Rucer517 @M_89 @Oliwood @denseanddumb @grifmaster @Stock__Twists 

However, he noted that to be booked in the current quarter, the iPhone sales most likely would have had to take place before Dec. 15, meaning that most of the current sales will likely find themselves in next year's results.

"I think this going to come in a little bit more of a headwind," he said.
Still, Munster sees Apple ($AAPL) making up a good portion of the sales down the line as demand gets pushed off into later quarters.
"Investors should be aware of [the headwinds] but they shouldn't be worried about it," Munster contended.

@Uncle_Covid @Jamz83 @AllJackedUp @ShantP21 @Rucer517 @M_89 @Oliwood @denseanddumb @grifmaster @Stock__Twists 

Loup Ventures analyst Gene Munster said Wednesday that recent improvements in supply chain bottlenecks for the iPhone product will be "too little too late" for Apple's ($AAPL) Q4 results but most of those lost sales will push out into next year.

Speaking to CNBC, the Loup Ventures managing partner also noted that other products have actually seen a deteriorating supply situation, leading to long lead times for products like the iPad and the MacBook Pro.

Munster specified that his channel checks show a 42-day backlog for an iPad, compared to 40 days a month ago. For the MacBook, the same statistics expanded from 18 days last month to 25 days now.

The Loup Ventures analyst highlighted the fact that the iPhone wait time had shrunk dramatically, from nine days to one day. 

https://seekingalpha.com/news/3782841-apple-supply-chain-issues-will-push-sales-into-next-year-loup-ventures-gene-munster

links.title: Apple supply chain issues will push sales into next year - Loup Ventures' Gene Munster
links.description: Loup Ventures analyst Gene Munster said Wednesday that recent improvements in supply chain bottlenecks for the iPhone product will be too little too late for Apple's (AAPL) Q4 results.
